message_1: Consider the following plaintext message: "MATHEMATICS". Use a substitution cipher where each letter is shifted by 3 positions in the alphabet (i.e., A becomes D, B becomes E, C becomes F, and so on) to encrypt this message. What is the resulting ciphertext message?
message_2: The resulting ciphertext message after shifting each letter by 3 positions in the alphabet is: "PDWKHPDWLFV".
